ygData.subject: simple logic functions
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I m new to neat and I was trying to do some simple things like add an AND and OR case in addition to the XOR operation.  I am running the c++

Hi,
    I'm new to neat and I was trying to do some simple things like add 
an AND and OR case in addition to the XOR operation.  I am running the 
c++ implementation and the only thing I thought needed changing was the 
evaluation function more specifically how the errorsum was calculated
i.e.
for "or"
    errorsum=(fabs(out[0])+fabs(1-out[1])+fabs(1-out[2])+fabs(1-out[3]));
and for "and"
    errorsum=(fabs(out[0])+fabs(1-out[1])+fabs(1-out[2])+fabs(1-out[3]));

The problem is that when I run the program for OR and AND it rarely 
finds a solution and if it does the final network seems overly complex 
and usually takes many more generations than XOR despite being a 
"simpler" function.  My question is whether there should be more to 
change in the program or if neat is just better with XOR than AND or 
OR(I don't see why that would be...).  I figured since they were all 
binary logic functions the parameters could stay the same and the 
starting genome seemed as simple as it got so that didn't look like a 
problem.  I'm not too familiar with neat yet; maybe I'm overlooking 
something simple so any tips would help.   Thanks.

irvin h.
